de.dfki.lt.hfc

Class Interactive

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dfki.lt.hfc.Interactive

  • public class Interactive
extends java.lang.Object
    commands start with a keyword and additional arguments (possibly empty), potentially stretching over several lines; single-line commands: new new new truncate quit OR exit tuples add delete rules closure commands ask save dump load open close help multiple-line commands, finished by an _empty_ line: select selectall
    Since:
    JDK 1.5
    See Also:
    Query

      JLine's console reader

      this setting is used for output encoding in Interactive
      Query query 
      private java.io.PrintStream queryOutput
      this print stream is needed to redirect the output obtained by a query
      RuleStore ruleStore 
      int truncate
      a negative truncate value indicates NO truncation
      TupleStore tupleStore 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Interactive()
      used by the main() method to invoke the interaction
      Interactive(ForwardChainer fc) 
      Interactive(java.lang.String commandFile)
      used by the main() method to evaluate commands stored in commandFile; interaction is NOT allowed afterwards
      Interactive(java.lang.String namespaceFile, java.lang.String tupleFile) 
      Interactive(java.lang.String namespaceFile, java.lang.String tupleFile, java.lang.String ruleFile) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      starts the read-eval-print loop, e.g., time java -server -cp .:../lib/trove-2.1.0.jar:../lib/jline-0_9_5.jar -Xmx13500m de/dfki/lt/hfc/Interactive ../src/resources/default.ns ../src/resources/default.eqred.nt ../src/resources/default.eqred.rdl
      private void processAdd(java.lang.String line) 
      private void processAsk(java.lang.String line)
      checks whether a single ground tuple (tuple NOT containing any variable) exists in the tuple store; full ASK queries can be simulated by using SELECT, followed by a test whether the result is empty or not

      private void processClose()

      • processAsk

        private void processAsk(java.lang.String line)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        checks whether a single ground tuple (tuple NOT containing any variable) exists in the tuple store; full ASK queries can be simulated by using SELECT, followed by a test whether the result is empty or not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
